intro: Meibomia longiarticulata, commonly known as the long-stemmed meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals and a prominent tube, attracting various pollinators. Meibomia longiarticulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
